[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Transcript Integrity] When sending DKGTranscript via send_rpc(), is the transcript cryptographically bound to the sender's identity preventing impersonation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Man-in-the-Middle] Does send_rpc() use authenticated encryption for DKG messages, or can a network attacker intercept and modify transcript data in transit? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Compression Oracle] Can the Compressed protocol variant leak information about DKG transcript content through compression side-channels? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Response Mismatch] Can send_rpc() receive a response that doesn't match the original request (e.g., TranscriptRequest gets a response for wrong epoch), causing state inconsistency? (High)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Duplicate Responses] If send_rpc() is called multiple times with the same message, can duplicate responses cause validators to process the same transcript multiple times? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Inconsistent Serialization] Can different validators produce different byte representations when calling to_bytes_by_protocol() on the same DKGMessage, breaking DKG aggregation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: get_peer_network_id_for_peer()] [TODO Comment] The TODO comment states 'we shouldn't need to expose this' - does this indicate a design flaw where network ID abstraction is broken? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: get_peer_network_id_for_peer()] [NetworkId Hardcoding] Always using NetworkId::Validator prevents DKG from working on test networks or multiple network contexts - is this a security limitation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Network Client Reliability] Does send_rpc() handle network_client failures gracefully, or can network layer crashes propagate to DKG causing total ceremony failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: sort_peers_by_latency()] [Network Metrics Trust] Does sort_peers_by_latency() trust network_client's latency metrics, or can Byzantine network layer report fake metrics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Transcript Request Flooding] Can a Byzantine validator spam TranscriptRequest messages via send_rpc() causing honest validators to waste resources generating duplicate responses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Malicious Transcript Response] Can send_rpc() receive a malicious TranscriptResponse containing invalid cryptographic data, and does it validate the transcript before accepting? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Transcript Size Limit] Are there size limits on DKGTranscript payloads in to_bytes_by_protocol(), or can malicious transcripts cause serialization of multi-gigabyte data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Dealer Epoch Mismatch] Can an attacker send DKGTranscriptRequest with manipulated dealer_epoch field causing validators to respond with transcripts for wrong epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Await Deadlock] Can send_rpc().await deadlock if the underlying network_client's send_to_peer_rpc() never completes, hanging the entire DKG ceremony? (High)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc_raw()] [Async Cancellation Safety] If send_rpc_raw().await is cancelled, does it properly clean up network resources, or can this leak connections? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Future Polling] Can concurrent polling of send_rpc() futures cause race conditions in the underlying network_client state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [PeerId Validation] Does send_rpc() validate that peer is a valid PeerId (not zero/default), or can invalid peer IDs cause network layer crashes? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc_raw()] [Bytes Validation] Does send_rpc_raw() validate that message Bytes is not empty or exceeds size limits before sending? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Message Validation] Does to_bytes_by_protocol() validate DKGMessage structure before serialization, or can malformed messages cause serialization errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Byzantine Response] Can a Byzantine validator return a valid DKGMessage response that is semantically incorrect (e.g., transcript for wrong epoch) bypassing type-level checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: send_rpc()] [Equivocation Detection] Does send_rpc() enable detection of Byzantine equivocation (sending different transcripts to different peers), or is this handled at higher layers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: sort_peers_by_latency()] [Byzantine Peer Ordering] Can Byzantine validators manipulate peer ordering via sort_peers_by_latency() to bias DKG leader selection toward malicious nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Function: to_bytes_by_protocol()] [Selective Encoding] Can a Byzantine validator provide different message encodings to different peers when calling to_bytes_by_protocol(), causing protocol divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/dkg/src/network_interface.rs] [Constants: RPC] [Protocol Versioning] Do the three RPC protocol variants (Compressed/Bcs/Json) handle version upgrades safely, or can version mismatches during DKG cause failures? (Medium)
